primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus journeys toward the cross (The Road to Calvary) to die for humanity, enduring the specific agony of betrayal by a friend.

tekstueel_bewijs: our Lord's journey toward crucifixion and death
Jesus is on his way to die for you and me
The odyssey of God's love moves now toward its climax

object.identificatie: The Cross / Salvation of 'you and me' / Fulfillment of God's will
tekstueel_bewijs: suffering unto death for us on the cross
Jesus is on his way to die for you and me
not as I will, but as thou wilt
mounting on wings of consecrated imagination

tegenstander.identificatie: Judas / Betrayal / Sin / The Cup of Sorrow
tekstueel_bewijs: the slimy act of turning a friend... over to his enemies
the bitter dregs, the elements of the dread concoction
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Betrayal is framed as a 'cosmic term' affecting the very soul of the Son of God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer must identify and pluck out the 'bitter weeds' of sin to avoid betraying Jesus like Judas did.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer ('Christian man, woman')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon moves from what Jesus did (Primary) to what the hearer must do to avoid repeating Judas's sin (Secondary).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God's Love → Salvation → You and Me

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus is on his way to die for you and me.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You and I have betrayed our Lord.
Beg the Lord to help you pluck it out now.

voorbeelden: I am anxious for you to see
The preacher... pondered some of the things
having been exposed to the Word of God
with God's grace and Christ's help
beg the Lord to help you pluck it out

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that while humans are prone to betrayal (lack of power), they must seek the 'Pouvoir' (power) from God to change.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S1 (Jesus as friend) to S2 (Judas's betrayal) to ~S2 (the call to straighten it out now).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Jesus remains a 'Friend' even in the face of betrayal, offering a path back from S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; betrayal is described as 'slimy', 'loathsome', and 'hideous'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there is a strong moral warning, the engine of the sermon is the 'odyssey of God's love' and Jesus's persistent friendship despite human failure.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: I would want us to see ourselves in this... when you and I have betrayed our Lord.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Primary Subject of Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is on his way to die for you and me.
Friend, I am still on your side.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Judas is used as a negative exemplar of what happens when one allows 'bitter weeds' to grow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Jesus as the one who remains faithful when all friends (including the hearer) betray Him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Conviction of sin and realization of the need for grace.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Total depravity/Human frailty vs. Divine faithfulness.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon beautifully integrates the historical narrative of Judas with the contemporary experience of the hearer.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'Judas, of all people' (responsibility) and 'Friend, I am still on your side' (grace).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is on his way to die for you and me.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon asks the Lord to 'help you pluck it out', implying an external endowment of power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is a 'process of corruption' and 'bitter weed'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully keeps Jesus as the Subject of the primary salvific action while using Judas to convict the hearer.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as Judas (Opponent) can lead to despair.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Friend' who is sought by Jesus.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Jesus calls the betrayer 'Friend' before the betrayer repents.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on how the 'Friendship of Jesus' actually provides the power to change.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The description of betrayal is already visceral.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Maintain the current flow from Christ's suffering to our response.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful, Christ-centered sermon that uses narrative structure to bridge the gap between the biblical text and the hearer's soul.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Focuses on the functional roles (Actants) rather than just the emotional metaphors of the 'cup'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Looks at the narrative 'engine' of the Road to Calvary rather than just the Greek meaning of 'kiss'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the hearer is positioned as the 'Opponent' who is being invited back into the role of 'Receiver' by the 'Subject' (Jesus).

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (journeyed, met, looked, recoiled, prayed, died, speaks, looks)
Judas (went, drew near, betrayed, led, threw away, stole)
We/You (betrayed, turned him over, hear, lie, cheat, steal)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Friend' actant to bridge the gap between Opponent and Receiver.
